title: King & Pawn: Key Squares
description: White must advance the king to a key square (d5, e5, or f5) to promote the pawn.
objective: Win by promoting the f-pawn. Use key squares to escort it.

title: King Ahead of Pawn
description: King is already on a key square — this should be a straightforward win.
objective: Promote the f-pawn. The king is ideally placed ahead of it.

title: Pawn on the 5th Rank
description: King on the 6th rank, pawn on 5th — this is a won position for White.
objective: Promote the e-pawn. King is already on its ideal square.

title: Stalemate Defense: Rook Pawn
description: Black has a rook pawn but White can draw with correct defense — stalemate trap in the corner.
objective: Draw by reaching the a1 corner. When the pawn reaches a2, White is stalemated.

title: Defending with Opposition
description: White defends a lost-looking position by keeping opposition on the pawn's file.
objective: Draw by maintaining opposition directly in front of the pawn.

title: Two Connected Pawns Win
description: Two connected pawns on the 6th rank with king support. One will promote.
objective: Promote one of the pawns. Advance the correct one first.

title: Winning with g-pawn
description: Standard K+P vs K with g-pawn. White must navigate to key squares.
objective: Promote the g-pawn by advancing the king to key squares first.

title: Avoid Stalemate!
description: White must be careful not to stalemate Black while promoting.
objective: Win without stalemating. Find the right king move.

title: Philidor Defense
description: Black can draw with the Philidor position — rook on the 3rd rank, then checking from behind.
objective: Draw using the Philidor technique. Keep the rook on the 6th rank cutting off the king.

title: Rook + Pawn vs Rook: Cutting Off the King
description: White's rook cuts off Black's king while the pawn advances.
objective: Win by keeping the enemy king cut off from the pawn.

title: Rook + g-pawn vs King
description: Rook and pawn vs lone king. Use the rook to shield the pawn's advance.
objective: Promote the g-pawn with rook support.

title: R+P vs R: King Support
description: White has R+P but needs good king placement. Advance the pawn with king escort.
objective: Win by coordinating rook and king to push the e-pawn.

title: Queen vs King — Basic Checkmate
description: Queen and king vs lone king. Practice the systematic checkmate technique.
objective: Checkmate with queen and king. Drive the king to the edge.

title: Queen vs b-pawn on 7th
description: Queen vs b-pawn. Can White avoid stalemate and win?
objective: Win the pawn using queen checks to bring the king closer.

title: Queen Checkmate Technique
description: Queen + King vs King. Drive the enemy to the edge with systematic queen moves.
objective: Deliver checkmate using queen and king coordination.

title: Bishop & King vs King — Insufficient
description: Bishop and king cannot force checkmate against a lone king. This is a draw.
objective: Recognize that this position is a theoretical draw — insufficient material.

title: Knight Stalemate Trap
description: Knight can accidentally cause stalemate. Be careful with the mating net.
objective: Avoid stalemate while restricting the enemy king.

title: Knight + d-pawn on 6th
description: Advanced pawn on the 6th with knight support. Win by promoting.
objective: Force promotion of the d-pawn using the knight.

title: Zugzwang in Pawn Ending
description: A mutual zugzwang position. The side to move loses!
objective: Understand zugzwang — whoever moves is in trouble.

title: Pawn Race — Counting Tempi
description: Both sides race to promote. Count the tempi to see who queens first.
objective: Win the pawn race by promoting first or with a tempo advantage.

title: Outside Passed Pawn
description: The outside passed pawn is a powerful weapon — it decoys the enemy king.
objective: Win using the outside passed pawn to decoy Black's king.

title: Racing Passed Pawns
description: Both sides have a passed pawn racing to promote. Who wins the race?
objective: Promote the b-pawn or stop Black's a-pawn. Calculate the race.

title: Complex Pawn Break
description: A complex pawn structure. Find the breakthrough to create a winning passed pawn.
objective: Find the correct pawn break to win material or promote.

title: Distant Passed Pawn
description: White's h-pawn becomes a decoy to lure the Black king away.
objective: Win by advancing the h-pawn to distract, then capture on the queenside.

title: Knight vs Pawn — Blockade
description: The knight blockades the passed pawn while the king approaches.
objective: Win by blockading the pawn with the knight and using the king.

title: Bishop vs Pawns: Good Bishop
description: Bishop is strong when pawns are on both sides of the board.
objective: Exploit the bishop's long-range to win pawns or promote.

title: Knight + Pawn vs King + Pawn
description: Knight and fixed pawns. Knight must outmaneuver to create a winning advantage.
objective: Win by using the knight to outflank while pawns are fixed.

title: Reti Study
description: The legendary Reti study (1921). White's king simultaneously chases and supports.
objective: Draw by chasing Black's h-pawn AND supporting your c-pawn simultaneously.

title: Two Knights Checkmate
description: Two knights cannot force checkmate against a lone king, but with a pawn it's different.
objective: Win using two knights — the pawn prevents stalemate.

title: Rook + Passed Pawn vs Rook
description: White's c-pawn is advanced. Can it promote with rook support?
objective: Promote the c-pawn using the rook to shield from checks.

title: Rook + Pawn vs Pawn — Blockade Win
description: White's a-pawn is blockaded but the rook can force a win from behind.
objective: Win by using the rook to support the a-pawn's advance.

title: Mutual Zugzwang — Fixed Center
description: A complex mutual zugzwang. The side to move loses because every move weakens the position.
objective: Navigate the zugzwang to outflank Black's king.

title: Triangulation Technique
description: White must triangulate to reach the same position with Black to move. A key endgame skill.
objective: Win by triangulating — lose a tempo to put Black in zugzwang.

title: Bishop + Pawn vs Knight — Promotion
description: White's bishop supports the e-pawn while the knight struggles to blockade.
objective: Promote the e-pawn using the bishop to control key squares.

title: Knight + Pawn vs Knight — Promotion Race
description: Both sides have a knight. White's advanced c-pawn is the key advantage.
objective: Promote the c-pawn despite Black's knight trying to blockade.

title: Distant Opposition — Complex
description: With symmetric pawns, the distant opposition determines the winner. Every tempo matters.
objective: Win by seizing the distant opposition to outflank.

title: Rook Endgame — Domination
description: White's active rook on the 7th rank combined with the centralized king creates a winning squeeze.
objective: Win by restricting the Black king while neutralizing the d-pawn.

title: Zugzwang Chain Reaction
description: A subtle pawn ending. White triangulates to put Black in zugzwang, forcing a pawn weakness.
objective: Win by creating zugzwang — force Black to move a pawn and collapse.

title: Rook + f-pawn vs Rook — Winning Technique
description: A critical rook endgame. White must advance the f-pawn while keeping the rook active.
objective: Win by pushing the f-pawn with correct rook and king coordination.

title: Locked Pawns — King Maneuver
description: Pawns are locked on the queenside. The only winning plan is a precise king march.
objective: Win by marching the king to capture the a7 pawn.

title: Fortress Walls — Outflanking Required
description: Completely locked pawns. The only winning idea is a long king march around the entire structure.
objective: Find the winning king path around the locked pawn chain.

title: Queen vs e-pawn on 2nd
description: White's pawn on e2 faces a queen. Can the pawn survive or is it hopeless?
objective: Discover how the queen systematically wins the pawn and delivers mate.

title: Knight vs Bishop — Open Board
description: Knight versus bishop with no pawns. A theoretical draw, but the technique is instructive.
objective: Recognize that N vs B (no pawns) is a draw. Practice the defensive technique.

title: Queen vs Rook — Skewer Pattern
description: The classic queen vs rook winning pattern. Check to separate king and rook, then skewer.
objective: Win the rook by forcing a skewer with queen checks.

title: Rook + Knight vs Rook
description: Rook and knight against a lone rook. White tries to exploit the extra piece.
objective: Win using the knight to create mating threats and fork possibilities.

title: Knight vs Knight — Pawn Structure Matters
description: Symmetrical knights but White's pawn structure is slightly better. Convert the edge.
objective: Win by exploiting the better pawn structure with active knight play.

title: Bishop + Pawns vs Pawns — Diagonal Breakthrough
description: White's bishop supports the queenside pawns. Find the winning plan.
objective: Win by using the bishop to break through on the queenside.

title: Fixed Pawns — Losing the Opposition
description: Fixed pawns on both sides. Whoever controls the opposition wins the breakthrough.
objective: Win by using opposition to break through the pawn chain.

title: Queen vs Rook — Third Rank Defense
description: Black's rook tries to shelter near the king. White systematically breaks the defense.
objective: Win the rook by driving the king to the edge and applying the skewer.

title: Rook vs King — Restricting Ranks
description: Use the rook to cut off the king rank by rank while advancing your own king.
objective: Restrict the enemy king using the rook. Drive it toward the edge.

title: Rook + Pawns — 7th Rank Dominance
description: White's rook occupies the 6th rank, restricting the Black king.
objective: Use the rook on the 6th rank to create winning threats.

title: Rook + Pawn vs Pawn — Active Rook Wins
description: White's active rook and passed f-pawn outweigh Black's g-pawn.
objective: Win by activating the rook and pushing the f-pawn.

title: Bishop + King vs King — Insufficient Material
description: Bishop and king cannot force checkmate. This is always a draw.
objective: Recognize insufficient material — K+B vs K is always a draw.

title: Bishop + Pawns — Fixed Center
description: Use the bishop to support a king march around the locked pawns.
objective: Win by outflanking through the kingside.

title: Knight + King vs King — Insufficient Material
description: Knight and king cannot force checkmate. This is always a draw.
objective: Recognize that K+N vs K is a theoretical draw.

title: Knight + Pawn vs King — Escort Plan
description: The knight guards key squares while the pawn advances.
objective: Promote the e-pawn with knight and king coordination.

title: Knight vs e-pawn — Capture Race
description: The knight repositions to capture the enemy e-pawn.
objective: Maneuver the knight to win the e4 pawn.

title: Knight + Pawn vs Pawn — Outpost Power
description: The knight dominates from a central outpost while the pawn advances.
objective: Win by using the knight to support the d-pawn.

title: Queen + King vs King — Edge Drive
description: The queen and king systematically drive the enemy to the edge.
objective: Deliver checkmate using queen and king coordination.

title: Queen Mate — Support from Behind
description: The queen restricts the enemy king while the player's king approaches.
objective: Use the queen to trap the king, then bring your king to help.

title: King + Pawn vs King — Basic Opposition
description: The fundamental pawn endgame. White has the opposition and wins.
objective: Promote the e-pawn using the opposition.

title: Pawn Race — Who Queens First?
description: Both sides have a passed pawn. Count the tempi to see who wins.
objective: Win the pawn race by promoting first.

title: Outside Passed Pawn — Decoy
description: Create an outside passer to decoy the Black king.
objective: Win by using the a-pawn as a decoy.

title: Zugzwang — Kingside Bind
description: White's king penetrates and Black is in zugzwang.
objective: Win by placing Black in zugzwang.

title: Knight + Pawn vs King — Basic Technique
description: Knight and pawn against king. Use the knight to clear the path.
objective: Promote the f-pawn with knight support.

title: Rook vs Knight — Separation Attack
description: The rook separates the knight from its king to win material.
objective: Win the knight by separating it from king support.

title: Rook on the 6th — Kingside Squeeze
description: The rook dominates from the 6th rank while pawns support.
objective: Win by squeezing the enemy king with the rook.

title: Queen vs Rook — Winning the Rook
description: Win the rook using checks to separate it from the king.
objective: Force the rook away from king support, then capture it.

title: Rook vs King — Rank Restriction
description: Use the rook to cut off the king rank by rank. Systematic approach.
objective: Restrict the enemy king toward the edge.

title: Rook Behind Passed Pawn — Classic Principle
description: Tarrasch's rule: place the rook behind the passed pawn.
objective: Advance the a-pawn with the rook supporting from behind.

title: Active Rook Wins Material
description: White's active rook attacks the g6 pawn. Black's rook is passive on a1.
objective: Win the g-pawn with the active rook.

title: Wrong Bishop — The h-pawn Draw
description: The dark-squared bishop can't control h8. Classic drawn position.
objective: Try to promote. Discover why this position is a draw.

title: Same-Color Bishops — Pawn Majority
description: Both sides have same-color bishops. White's pawn majority decides.
objective: Use the extra pawn with bishop support to win.

title: Knight + King vs King — Draw
description: K+N vs K is insufficient material. Always a draw.
objective: Recognize this is a theoretical draw.

title: Knight + e-pawn — Advanced Post
description: The knight on c6 controls key squares for the pawn's advance.
objective: Promote the e-pawn with the knight's support.

title: Queen + King vs King — Wall Technique
description: Systematically push the king to the wall using the queen.
objective: Drive the king to the edge for checkmate.

title: Queen vs Rook — Winning the Rook
description: Use checks to drive the king away from the rook, then capture it.
objective: Win the rook with queen checks.

title: K+P vs K — Opposition Win
description: The most fundamental endgame. White has the opposition.
objective: Promote the e-pawn using the opposition.

title: Pawn Race — Tempo Advantage
description: White's b-pawn races against Black's a-pawn. Tempo is key.
objective: Win the pawn race or gain a decisive tempo.

title: Outside Passer — Classic Decoy
description: Create an outside passed pawn to decoy the enemy king.
objective: Sacrifice to create a passer and win on the other wing.

title: Rook vs Knight — Separation
description: Separate the knight from its king, then win it.
objective: Win the knight using the rook's long range.
